div.p: Greetings. The reason I have not written about Comander is because Bellinchetti and Mr. Friedrich traveled there, and I did not doubt that they would inform you of everything. Then, when the lords instructed me to write, I replied that it was proper and in their interest for them to write themselves. Regarding your friend and my colleague, I fully hope, as you write; from a single sermon, I perceive him to be very prepared for preaching. May Christ the Lord bless our hope. But why do I say more? You will learn everything from him and from the letters of our lords. Farewell again, most excellent man.
From Chur, on the first day of March in the year 1557.
